messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Post-holiday ramble
messages.msgSnippet: I LOVE that quote!  It s like people telling me I m so blessed to have twins, I sometimes forget that I believe that one too! :o) And I do LOVE this way of
messages.messageBody:
I LOVE that quote! It's like people telling me I'm so blessed to have twins, I sometimes forget that I believe that one too! :o)

And I do LOVE this way of life. When I so often observe kids being treated like second class citizens I'm reminded that this is the life I want with my kids and for my kids...slower, free, equal rights for everyone in our household

Okay, I'm off to dig deeper.

Jodi

Kendrah Nilsestuen <carebear-79@...> wrote:
**I find myself wishing that Waldorf or something like it felt like
'IT' for us,
because that would be so easy to explain to relatives.** Jodi wrote

Hi Jodi,

I *just* read this quote today. Seemed so timely after reading your
post. It is... "If you are lucky enough to find a way of life you
love, you have to find the courage to live it." John Irving.

I know somedays I have to dig deeper for my courage than others!:)

Kendrah
